intro: Catopsis nutans var. stenopetala, commonly known as the narrow-petaled catopsis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Bromeliaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. This plant is characterized by its rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves that form a water-holding cup. The flowers are small and inconspicuous, typically greenish-white in color, and bloom in the axils of the leaves. It thrives in shaded, humid environments and is often found in forest understories.
